questions.question: What are the four main principles of Object-Oriented Programming?
What is a class in OOP?
options: A blueprint or template for creating objects

questions.question: What is an object in OOP?
What is encapsulation in OOP?
options: Wrapping data and methods into a single unit

questions.question: What is inheritance in OOP?
options: A mechanism where one class acquires properties of another

questions.question: What is polymorphism in OOP?
options: Ability of objects to take many forms

questions.question: What is abstraction in OOP?
options: Hiding complex implementation details and showing only essential features

questions.question: Which of the following is an access modifier in OOP?
What is method overloading?
options: Multiple methods with same name but different parameters

questions.question: What is method overriding?
options: Redefining a method in subclass that exists in parent class
Creating multiple methods with same name

questions.question: What is a constructor in OOP?
options: A special method called when object is created

questions.question: What is a destructor in OOP?
options: A method called when object is destroyed

questions.question: What is an abstract class?
options: A class with only concrete methods
A class that cannot be instantiated and may contain abstract methods

questions.question: What is an interface in OOP?
options: A way to inherit multiple classes
A class with all abstract methods
A contract that specifies methods a class must implement

questions.question: What is aggregation in OOP?
options: A weak 'has-a' relationship where objects can exist independently

questions.question: What is the difference between association and composition?
What is coupling in OOP?
options: Number of methods in a class

questions.question: What is cohesion in OOP?
options: Number of classes in a program
Degree to which elements of a class belong together
Number of methods in a class

questions.question: Which principle suggests that a class should have only one reason to change?
